content: the crochet fox egg is the perfect project to use for decorating at easter time or sparking imaginative play year-round smaller in size and a beginner-friendly pattern it is also a great way to use up scrap yarn and practice a variety of embroidery techniques get ready for one of the cutest stash busters yet the crochet fox egg is great to use as gifts for all ages easter decor decoration imaginative play and more pattern information + your pdf purchase includes written instructions and helpful photographs to aid in construction + the pattern is written in english using us crochet terminology + the pattern is formatted to have one featured image at the beginning of the pattern for reference with all other full-sized images at the end for easy optional printing skills needed + the skill level needed is advanced beginner + the techniques you will need to know include chain single_crochet slip_stitch increase invisible decrease the adjustable magic ring and hand embroidery materials needed + yarn in your choice of colors about 40-43 yds/36 5-39 m of worsted/aran + a size e/4 3 5 mm crochet hook + stitch markers + stuffing + safety eyes 8mm + tapestry needle + pins + scissors + chopstick to help stuff + embroidery floss + embroidery needle finished measurements using hook size e/4 3 5 mm the crochet fox egg measures approximately 3 inches 7 6 cm tall and approximately 6 5 inches 16 5 cm in circumference not including the muzzle thank you thank you for supporting my small business it means the world wishing you a blessed day as you spread kindness and creativity happy crocheting find more this pattern along with many other designs can be found here on ravelry and the blog at www jenhayescreations com copyright this pattern and its photos are copyright of jennifer hayes jen hayes creations and are for personal non-commercial use only you may not copy sell republish distribute or translate this pattern and its images in part or whole you are welcome to sell any finished items produced from this pattern please credit jen hayes creations as the designer and include a link to the pattern listing if selling the finished piece online thank you share your work follow along on instagram at @jenhayescreations tag @jenhayescreations and use the hashtag #jenhayescreations to show off your creations and of course link your projects to the
